intro: Guettarda tournefortiopsis, commonly known as the dwarf guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or limestone soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercialized.
